title: rustdoc: Some items in `cache.paths` are non-local

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: A-cross-crate-reexports
labels.description: Area: Documentation that has been re-exported from a different crate

body:
I tried this code: ```diff diff --git a/src/librustdoc/formats/cache.rs b/src/librustdoc/formats/cache.rs index 1e1fc2436aa..2d3858d7b17 100644 --- a/src/librustdoc/formats/cache.rs +++ b/src/librustdoc/formats/cache.rs @@ -3,7 +3,7 @@ use std::path::Path; use rustc_data_structures::fx::{FxHashMap, FxHashSet}; -use rustc_hir::def_id::{CrateNum, DefId, CRATE_DEF_INDEX}; +use rustc_hir::def_id::{CrateNum, LocalDefId, DefId, CRATE_DEF_INDEX}; use rustc_middle::middle::privacy::AccessLevels; use rustc_middle::ty::TyCtxt; use rustc_span::symbol::sym; @@ -16,6 +16,36 @@ use crate::html::render::cache::{get_index_search_type, ExternalLocation}; use crate::html::render::IndexItem; +#[derive(Clone)] +crate struct AssertLocalMap(FxHashMap); + +impl Default for AssertLocalMap { + fn default() -> Self { + Self(FxHashMap::default()) + } +} + +impl AssertLocalMap { + crate fn get(&self, k: &DefId) -> Option<&V> { + self.0.get(&k.as_local().unwrap()) + } + + crate fn contains_key(&self, k: &DefId) -> bool { + k.as_local().map_or(false, |local| self.0.contains_key(&local)) + } + + fn insert(&mut self, k: DefId, v: V) -> Option { + let local = k.as_local().unwrap_or_else(|| panic!( + "{:?} is not local", k + )); + self.0.insert(local, v) + } + + crate fn into_iter(self) -> impl Iterator { + self.0.into_iter().map(|(k, v)| (k.to_def_id(), v)) + } +} + /// This cache is used to store information about the [`clean::Crate`] being /// rendered in order to provide more useful documentation. This contains /// information like all implementors of a trait, all traits a type implements, @@ -40,7 +70,7 @@ /// URLs when a type is being linked to. External paths are not located in /// this map because the `External` type itself has all the information /// necessary. - crate paths: FxHashMap, ItemType)>, + crate paths: AssertLocalMap<(Vec, ItemType)>, /// Similar to `paths`, but only holds external paths. This is only used for /// generating explicit hyperlinks to other crates. ``` I expected to see this happen: No change in behavior; according to the comment, all items stored in `paths` are local. Instead, this happened: Rustdoc panics on nearly every test case in `src/test/rustdoc`. Here is an example: ``` ---- [rustdoc] rustdoc/intra-doc/trait-item.rs stdout ---- error: rustdoc failed! status: exit status: 101 ------------------------------------------ stderr: ------------------------------------------ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'DefId(2:2796 ~ core[87c3]::convert::{impl#7}::Error) is not local', src/librustdoc/formats/cache.rs:38:52 ``` ## Why is this bad? Various parts of rustdoc depend on `paths` being local. For example, https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/56dee7c49ecdec4c2c9eccc6ff966cf58847bda6/src/librustdoc/html/format.rs#L486-L492 only checks `external_paths` if `paths` is None. I don't know if this explictly leads to wrong behavior, but it does mean we can't distiguish between "not in extern_paths because it's local" and "not in extern_paths because of a bug". Here are all the places paths is read (not written): - https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/56dee7c49ecdec4c2c9eccc6ff966cf58847bda6/src/librustdoc/html/render/context.rs#L233 - this one I think could lead to rustdoc writing to the documentation folders of other crates :sweat_smile: - https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/56dee7c49ecdec4c2c9eccc6ff966cf58847bda6/src/librustdoc/formats/cache.rs#L265 - not sure of the impact of this one - https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/56dee7c49ecdec4c2c9eccc6ff966cf58847bda6/src/librustdoc/html/render/mod.rs#L2120 - this will result in some foreign impls not showing up in the sidebar - https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/56dee7c49ecdec4c2c9eccc6ff966cf58847bda6/src/librustdoc/html/render/write_shared.rs#L491 - no idea, that whole code looks very sketchy - https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/56dee7c49ecdec4c2c9eccc6ff966cf58847bda6/src/librustdoc/html/render/write_shared.rs#L531 - I think this will result in items duplicated in the JS sidebar file and the HTML (cc @jsha, I think you ran into this recently?) - https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/56dee7c49ecdec4c2c9eccc6ff966cf58847bda6/src/librustdoc/html/render/cache.rs#L36 ### Meta HEAD is 0ce21126b295608ab4704f678d53ae8d2e9b60d1. I found this while reviewing https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/86662.
